medical_history.chief_complaint: Severe cardiac cachexia and considering end-of-life options.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Mrs. H has experienced worsening function and quality of life over time despite maximum medical therapies. She currently struggles with dyspnea on minimal exertion (NYHA class IIIB), limited mobility due to arthritic joints, and has experienced multiple falls.
medical_history.past_medical_history: History of insulin-dependent diabetes, myocardial infarction in 1996 with stent placement, severe ischemic cardiomyopathy, hypothyroidism, breast cancer, depression treated with fluoxetine, allergic rhinitis, degenerative joint disease, pneumonia complicated by empyema, removal of a ruptured appendix, cholecystectomy, uterine suspension, gastroesophageal reflux, diabetic neuropathy, diabetic foot ulcers, orthostatic hypotension, anemia, spinal stenosis, and recurrent hyperkalemia.
medical_history.social_history: Lives alone in a second-floor apartment with assistance during the day from a personal care attendant. She has financial difficulties due to her daughter's recent job loss.
